info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api

Class TaskApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api.TaskApi

  • @Path(value="/task")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public class TaskApi
extends Object
    A Task is the basic module and represents for example a specific activity. For a creation of a task, the roles are needed which indicate who is allowed to fulfil this task. To complete the task only one of these roles is needed. One or more tasks can be assigned to a goal, so depending on the rule of the goal some additional tasks may also have to be completed to fulfill the goal so the player can earn the associated rewards. If the task is tradeable it can be offered in the marketplace, so that another player can do it and gets the reward of it. When a player has completed a task, it will be added to the player’s list of finished tasks. At the same time the date and time is also stored when this request was sent and the task was officially be done. If the task is the last one to fulfill a goal, the goal is also added to the player’s list of finished goals and the player will obtain all its associated rewards. It is possible to query all tasks which are associated with a particular organisation or with the help of the associated id one specific task. When a task was created it is possible to change the task’s name, description and roles of players who are allowed to fulfil this task. Furthermore a task can be set tradeable or not at a later point of time.

    • Method Detail

      • createNewTask

        @POST
 @Path(value="/")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createNewTask(@QueryParam(value="name") @NotNull
                                                                         String name,
                                                                         @QueryParam(value="description")
                                                                         String description,
                                                                         @QueryParam(value="tradeable") @DefaultValue(value="false")
                                                                         String tradeable,
                                                                         @QueryParam(value="roleIds") @DefaultValue(value="null") @ValidListOfDigitsOrNull(message="The role ids must be null or a valid list of numbers")
                                                                         String roleIds,
                                                                         @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                         String apiKey)
        Creates a new task and so the method generates the task-id. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned. By the creation values for its name, a short description what have to done and the roles who are allowed to complete the task. It is checked, if the id of the roles are positive numbers otherwise a message for the invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the task. This parameter is required.
        description - Optional a short description can be set. This can be for example explain what a player has to do to complete the task.
        tradeable - This field specifies whether the task is tradeable or not. The default value is set to not tradeable (false).
        roleIds - Optionally a list of role ids separated by commas who are allowed to fulfil the task.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this task belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Task in JSON.

      • getTasks

        @GET
 @Path(value="/*")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTasks(@QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                    String apiKey)
        Returns a list of all tasks associated with the passed API key. If the key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this task belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Task in JSON.

      • getTradeableTasks

        @GET
 @Path(value="/tradeable/*")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTradeableTasks(@QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                       String apiKey)
        Returns a list of all tasks which are tradeable and associated with the passed API key. If the key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which these tasks belong to.
        Returns:

      • getTask

        @GET
 @Path(value="/{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTask(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The task id must be a valid number")
                                                                      String id,
                                                                      @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                      String apiKey)
        Returns the task associated with the passed id and API key. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the player id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - Required path parameter as integer which uniquely identify the Task.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this task belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Task in JSON.

      • completeTask

        @POST
 @Path(value="/{id}/complete/{playerId}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response completeTask(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The task id must be a valid number")
                                                                                                String id,
                                                                                                @PathParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                                                String playerId,
                                                                                                @QueryParam(value="finishedDate")
                                                                                                String finishedDate,
                                                                                                @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                                String apiKey)
        This method completes a task with the assigned id and associated API key. The player-id represents the player who has completed the task. The task is added to the list of finished tasks of this player. Thereby the task becomes a finished task object and the time and date is also stored when the task was officially be done.
        Parameters:
        id - Required integer which uniquely identify the Task.
        playerId - The if ot the player who has completed the task. This parameter is required.
        finishedDate - Optionally the local tate time can be passed when the task was finished. If the value is null, the finshedDate is set to the time and date when the query was sent.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this task belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Task in JSON.

      • changeTaskAttributes

        @PUT
 @Path(value="/{id}/attributes")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changeTaskAttributes(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                              String id,
                                                                                              @QueryParam(value="attribute") @NotNull
                                                                                              String attribute,
                                                                                              @QueryParam(value="value") @NotNull
                                                                                              String value,
                                                                                              @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                              String apiKey)
        With this method the fields of a Task can be changed. For this the id of the task, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the new value are needed. To modify the name or the description the new String has to be passed with the attribute field. A new list of roles can be passed when their ids are separated by commas. Also the task can be set tradeable or not by passing the value true or false. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the ids are a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the task that should be changed. This parameter is required.
        attribute - The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required. The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field: "taskName", "description", "tradeable" and "roles".
        value - The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this task belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Task in JSON.

      • deleteTask

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="/{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteTask(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The task id must be a valid number")
                                                                            String id,
                                                                            @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                            String apiKey)
        Removes the task with the assigned id and associated API key from data base. It is checked, if the passed id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - Required integer which uniquely identify the Task.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this task belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Task in JSON.
